thread.title: Reduced visibility, icy sections and lots of snow on Sask. highways Sunday
thread.title_full: Reduced visibility, icy sections and lots of snow on Sask. highways Sunday

author: cbc
title: Reduced visibility, icy sections and lots of snow on Sask. highways Sunday
text:
Saskatchewan highways are currently being blanketed with snow throughout the province.
Earlier in the week, Environment Canada announced up to 30 centimetres of snow could fall over the weekend. With the snowfall in full swing on Sunday, the Ministry of Highways says most of the province's highways will have snow and icy sections.
Highway 1, which crosses the province, has sections of reduced visibility, loose and drifting snow, and icy or slippery sections. There is a patch of road between Whitewood, Sask., and the Manitoba border which has seasonal driving conditions.
The ministry emphasized that conditions can change rapidly and unexpectedly. Seasonal driving means there are no specific problems but there is potential for occasional slippery sections or snow drifts.
Up to 30 cm of snow may hit southwest Saskatchewan Conditions throughout the province: Carlyle: Icy or slippery sections, loose and swirling snow, with some ice-covered sections. Weyburn: Icy or slippery sections, loose, swirling and drifting snow. Regina: Loose, swirling and drifting snow. Moose Jaw: Icy or slippery sections, with some loose, swirling and drifting snow, as well as snow packed sections. Swift Current: Reduced visibility, icy or slippery sections with some loose, swirling and drifting snow. Yorkton: Icy or slippery sections and swirling snow. Wynyard: Icy or slippery sections and swirling snow. Saskatoon: Icy or slippery sections, as well as loose and swirling snow. North Battleford: Icy or slippery sections, as well as loose and swirling snow. Kindersley: Icy or slippery sections, as well as loose and swirling snow. Tisdale: Snow-packed roads with icy or slippery sections. Prince Albert: Icy or slippery sections, loose snow and swirling snow. Meadow Lake: Icy or slippery sections, loose snow and swirling snow. La Ronge: Snow-packed roads with icy or slippery sections. Buffalo Narrows: Icy or slippery sections, snow packed and swirling snow.
